00044 /* used as an extern, defined in bmesh.h */
00045 BMAllocTemplate bm_mesh_allocsize_default = {512, 1024, 2048, 512};
00046 BMAllocTemplate bm_mesh_chunksize_default = {512, 1024, 2048, 512};
00047 
00048 static void bm_mempool_init(BMesh *bm, const BMAllocTemplate *allocsize)
00049 {
00050     bm->vpool = BLI_mempool_create(sizeof(BMVert), allocsize->totvert, bm_mesh_chunksize_default.totvert, BLI_MEMPOOL_ALLOW_ITER);
00051     bm->epool = BLI_mempool_create(sizeof(BMEdge), allocsize->totedge, bm_mesh_chunksize_default.totedge, BLI_MEMPOOL_ALLOW_ITER);
00052     bm->lpool = BLI_mempool_create(sizeof(BMLoop), allocsize->totloop, bm_mesh_chunksize_default.totloop, 0);
00053     bm->fpool = BLI_mempool_create(sizeof(BMFace), allocsize->totface, bm_mesh_chunksize_default.totface, BLI_MEMPOOL_ALLOW_ITER);
00054 
00055 #ifdef USE_BMESH_HOLES
00056     bm->looplistpool = BLI_mempool_create(sizeof(BMLoopList), allocsize[3], allocsize[3], FALSE, FALSE);
00057 #endif
00058 
00059     /* allocate one flag pool that we don't get rid of. */
00060     bm->toolflagpool = BLI_mempool_create(sizeof(BMFlagLayer), 512, 512, 0);
00061 }
00062 
00072 BMesh *BM_mesh_create(BMAllocTemplate *allocsize)
00073 {
00074     /* allocate the structure */
00075     BMesh *bm = MEM_callocN(sizeof(BMesh), __func__);
00076     
00077     /* allocate the memory pools for the mesh elements */
00078     bm_mempool_init(bm, allocsize);
00079 
00080     /* allocate one flag pool that we don't get rid of. */
00081     bm->stackdepth = 1;
00082     bm->totflags = 1;
00083 
00084     return bm;
00085 }

00094 void BM_mesh_data_free(BMesh *bm)
00095 {
00096     BMVert *v;
00097     BMEdge *e;
00098     BMLoop *l;
00099     BMFace *f;
00100     
00101 
00102     BMIter iter;
00103     BMIter itersub;
00104     
00105     BM_ITER_MESH (v, &iter, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH) {
00106         CustomData_bmesh_free_block(&(bm->vdata), &(v->head.data));
00107     }
00108     BM_ITER_MESH (e, &iter, bm, BM_EDGES_OF_MESH) {
00109         CustomData_bmesh_free_block(&(bm->edata), &(e->head.data));
00110     }
00111     BM_ITER_MESH (f, &iter, bm, BM_FACES_OF_MESH) {
00112         CustomData_bmesh_free_block(&(bm->pdata), &(f->head.data));
00113         BM_ITER_ELEM (l, &itersub, f, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE) {
00114             CustomData_bmesh_free_block(&(bm->ldata), &(l->head.data));
00115         }
00116     }
00117 
00118     /* Free custom data pools, This should probably go in CustomData_free? */
00119     if (bm->vdata.totlayer) BLI_mempool_destroy(bm->vdata.pool);
00120     if (bm->edata.totlayer) BLI_mempool_destroy(bm->edata.pool);
00121     if (bm->ldata.totlayer) BLI_mempool_destroy(bm->ldata.pool);
00122     if (bm->pdata.totlayer) BLI_mempool_destroy(bm->pdata.pool);
00123 
00124     /* free custom data */
00125     CustomData_free(&bm->vdata, 0);
00126     CustomData_free(&bm->edata, 0);
00127     CustomData_free(&bm->ldata, 0);
00128     CustomData_free(&bm->pdata, 0);
00129 
00130     /* destroy element pools */
00131     BLI_mempool_destroy(bm->vpool);
00132     BLI_mempool_destroy(bm->epool);
00133     BLI_mempool_destroy(bm->lpool);
00134     BLI_mempool_destroy(bm->fpool);
00135 
00136     /* destroy flag pool */
00137     BLI_mempool_destroy(bm->toolflagpool);
00138 
00139 #ifdef USE_BMESH_HOLES
00140     BLI_mempool_destroy(bm->looplistpool);
00141 #endif
00142 
00143     BLI_freelistN(&bm->selected);
00144 
00145     BMO_error_clear(bm);
00146 }
00147 
00153 void BM_mesh_clear(BMesh *bm)
00154 {
00155     /* free old mesh */
00156     BM_mesh_data_free(bm);
00157     memset(bm, 0, sizeof(BMesh));
00158 
00159     /* allocate the memory pools for the mesh elements */
00160     bm_mempool_init(bm, &bm_mesh_allocsize_default);
00161 
00162     bm->stackdepth = 1;
00163     bm->totflags = 1;
00164 }
00165 
00171 void BM_mesh_free(BMesh *bm)
00172 {
00173     BM_mesh_data_free(bm);
00174 
00175     if (bm->py_handle) {
00176         /* keep this out of 'BM_mesh_data_free' because we wan't python
00177          * to be able to clear the mesh and maintain access. */
00178         extern void bpy_bm_generic_invalidate(void *self);
00179 
00180         bpy_bm_generic_invalidate(bm->py_handle);
00181         bm->py_handle = NULL;
00182     }
00183 
00184     MEM_freeN(bm);
00185 }

00192 void BM_mesh_normals_update(BMesh *bm, const short skip_hidden)
00193 {
00194     BMVert *v;
00195     BMFace *f;
00196     BMLoop *l;
00197     BMEdge *e;
00198     BMIter verts;
00199     BMIter faces;
00200     BMIter loops;
00201     BMIter edges;
00202     int index;
00203     float (*edgevec)[3];
00204     
00205     /* calculate all face normals */
00206     BM_ITER_MESH (f, &faces, bm, BM_FACES_OF_MESH) {
00207         if (skip_hidden && BM_elem_flag_test(f, BM_ELEM_HIDDEN))
00208             continue;
00209 #if 0   /* UNUSED */
00210         if (f->head.flag & BM_NONORMCALC)
00211             continue;
00212 #endif
00213 
00214         BM_face_normal_update(f);
00215     }
00216     
00217     /* Zero out vertex normals */
00218     BM_ITER_MESH (v, &verts, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH) {
00219         if (skip_hidden && BM_elem_flag_test(v, BM_ELEM_HIDDEN))
00220             continue;
00221 
00222         zero_v3(v->no);
00223     }
00224 
00225     /* compute normalized direction vectors for each edge. directions will be
00226      * used below for calculating the weights of the face normals on the vertex
00227      * normals */
00228     index = 0;
00229     edgevec = MEM_callocN(sizeof(float) * 3 * bm->totedge, "BM normal computation array");
00230     BM_ITER_MESH (e, &edges, bm, BM_EDGES_OF_MESH) {
00231         BM_elem_index_set(e, index); /* set_inline */
00232 
00233         if (e->l) {
00234             sub_v3_v3v3(edgevec[index], e->v2->co, e->v1->co);
00235             normalize_v3(edgevec[index]);
00236         }
00237         else {
00238             /* the edge vector will not be needed when the edge has no radial */
00239         }
00240 
00241         index++;
00242     }
00243     bm->elem_index_dirty &= ~BM_EDGE;
00244 
00245     /* add weighted face normals to vertices */
00246     BM_ITER_MESH (f, &faces, bm, BM_FACES_OF_MESH) {
00247 
00248         if (skip_hidden && BM_elem_flag_test(f, BM_ELEM_HIDDEN))
00249             continue;
00250 
00251         BM_ITER_ELEM (l, &loops, f, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE) {
00252             float *e1diff, *e2diff;
00253             float dotprod;
00254             float fac;
00255 
00256             /* calculate the dot product of the two edges that
00257              * meet at the loop's vertex */
00258             e1diff = edgevec[BM_elem_index_get(l->prev->e)];
00259             e2diff = edgevec[BM_elem_index_get(l->e)];
00260             dotprod = dot_v3v3(e1diff, e2diff);
00261 
00262             /* edge vectors are calculated from e->v1 to e->v2, so
00263              * adjust the dot product if one but not both loops
00264              * actually runs from from e->v2 to e->v1 */
00265             if ((l->prev->e->v1 == l->prev->v) ^ (l->e->v1 == l->v)) {
00266                 dotprod = -dotprod;
00267             }
00268 
00269             fac = saacos(-dotprod);
00270 
00271             /* accumulate weighted face normal into the vertex's normal */
00272             madd_v3_v3fl(l->v->no, f->no, fac);
00273         }
00274     }
00275     
00276     /* normalize the accumulated vertex normals */
00277     BM_ITER_MESH (v, &verts, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH) {
00278         if (skip_hidden && BM_elem_flag_test(v, BM_ELEM_HIDDEN))
00279             continue;
00280 
00281         if (normalize_v3(v->no) == 0.0f) {
00282             normalize_v3_v3(v->no, v->co);
00283         }
00284     }
00285     
00286     MEM_freeN(edgevec);
00287 }
00288 
00289 /*
00290  * This function ensures correct normals for the mesh, but
00291  * sets the flag BM_ELEM_TAG in flipped faces, to allow restoration
00292  * of original normals.
00293  *
00294  * if undo is 0: calculate right normals
00295  * if undo is 1: restore original normals
00296  */
00297 
00298 //keep in sycn with utils.c!
00299 #define FACE_FLIP   8
00300 static void bm_rationalize_normals(BMesh *bm, int undo)
00301 {
00302     BMOperator bmop;
00303     BMFace *f;
00304     BMIter iter;
00305     
00306     if (undo) {
00307         BM_ITER_MESH (f, &iter, bm, BM_FACES_OF_MESH) {
00308             if (BM_elem_flag_test(f, BM_ELEM_TAG)) {
00309                 BM_face_normal_flip(bm, f);
00310             }
00311             BM_elem_flag_disable(f, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00312         }
00313         
00314         return;
00315     }
00316     
00317     BMO_op_initf(bm, &bmop, "righthandfaces faces=%af do_flip=%b", FALSE);
00318     
00319     BMO_push(bm, &bmop);
00320     bmo_righthandfaces_exec(bm, &bmop);
00321     
00322     BM_ITER_MESH (f, &iter, bm, BM_FACES_OF_MESH) {
00323         BM_elem_flag_set(f, BM_ELEM_TAG, BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, f, FACE_FLIP));
00324     }
00325 
00326     BMO_pop(bm);
00327     BMO_op_finish(bm, &bmop);
00328 }
00329 
00330 static void UNUSED_FUNCTION(bm_mdisps_space_set)(Object *ob, BMesh *bm, int from, int to)
00331 {
00332     /* switch multires data out of tangent space */
00333     if (CustomData_has_layer(&bm->ldata, CD_MDISPS)) {
00334         BMEditMesh *em = BMEdit_Create(bm, FALSE);
00335         DerivedMesh *dm = CDDM_from_BMEditMesh(em, NULL, TRUE, FALSE);
00336         MDisps *mdisps;
00337         BMFace *f;
00338         BMIter iter;
00339         // int i = 0; // UNUSED
00340         
00341         multires_set_space(dm, ob, from, to);
00342         
00343         mdisps = CustomData_get_layer(&dm->loopData, CD_MDISPS);
00344         
00345         BM_ITER_MESH (f, &iter, bm, BM_FACES_OF_MESH) {
00346             BMLoop *l;
00347             BMIter liter;
00348             BM_ITER_ELEM (l, &liter, f, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE) {
00349                 MDisps *lmd = CustomData_bmesh_get(&bm->ldata, l->head.data, CD_MDISPS);
00350                 
00351                 if (!lmd->disps) {
00352                     printf("%s: warning - 'lmd->disps' == NULL\n", __func__);
00353                 }
00354                 
00355                 if (lmd->disps && lmd->totdisp == mdisps->totdisp) {
00356                     memcpy(lmd->disps, mdisps->disps, sizeof(float) * 3 * lmd->totdisp);
00357                 }
00358                 else if (mdisps->disps) {
00359                     if (lmd->disps)
00360                         MEM_freeN(lmd->disps);
00361                     
00362                     lmd->disps = MEM_dupallocN(mdisps->disps);
00363                     lmd->totdisp = mdisps->totdisp;
00364                     lmd->level = mdisps->level;
00365                 }
00366                 
00367                 mdisps++;
00368                 // i += 1;
00369             }
00370         }
00371         
00372         dm->needsFree = 1;
00373         dm->release(dm);
00374         
00375         /* setting this to NULL prevents BMEdit_Free from freeing it */
00376         em->bm = NULL;
00377         BMEdit_Free(em);
00378         MEM_freeN(em);
00379     }
00380 }
00381 
00389 void bmesh_edit_begin(BMesh *bm, int flag)
00390 {
00391     bm->opflag = flag;
00392     
00393     /* Most operators seem to be using BMO_OP_FLAG_UNTAN_MULTIRES to change the MDisps to
00394      * absolute space during mesh edits. With this enabled, changes to the topology
00395      * (loop cuts, edge subdivides, etc) are not reflected in the higher levels of
00396      * the mesh at all, which doesn't seem right. Turning off completely for now,
00397      * until this is shown to be better for certain types of mesh edits. */
00398 #if BMOP_UNTAN_MULTIRES_ENABLED
00399     /* switch multires data out of tangent space */
00400     if ((flag & BMO_OP_FLAG_UNTAN_MULTIRES) && CustomData_has_layer(&bm->ldata, CD_MDISPS)) {
00401         bmesh_mdisps_space_set(bm, MULTIRES_SPACE_TANGENT, MULTIRES_SPACE_ABSOLUTE);
00402 
00403         /* ensure correct normals, if possible */
00404         bmesh_rationalize_normals(bm, 0);
00405         BM_mesh_normals_update(bm);
00406     }
00407     else if (flag & BMO_OP_FLAG_RATIONALIZE_NORMALS) {
00408         bmesh_rationalize_normals(bm, 0);
00409     }
00410 #else
00411     if (flag & BMO_OP_FLAG_RATIONALIZE_NORMALS) {
00412         bm_rationalize_normals(bm, 0);
00413     }
00414 #endif
00415 }
00416 
00420 void bmesh_edit_end(BMesh *bm, int flag)
00421 {
00422     /* BMO_OP_FLAG_UNTAN_MULTIRES disabled for now, see comment above in bmesh_edit_begin. */
00423 #if BMOP_UNTAN_MULTIRES_ENABLED
00424     /* switch multires data into tangent space */
00425     if ((flag & BMO_OP_FLAG_UNTAN_MULTIRES) && CustomData_has_layer(&bm->ldata, CD_MDISPS)) {
00426         /* set normals to their previous winding */
00427         bmesh_rationalize_normals(bm, 1);
00428         bmesh_mdisps_space_set(bm, MULTIRES_SPACE_ABSOLUTE, MULTIRES_SPACE_TANGENT);
00429     }
00430     else if (flag & BMO_OP_FLAG_RATIONALIZE_NORMALS) {
00431         bmesh_rationalize_normals(bm, 1);
00432     }
00433 #else
00434     if (flag & BMO_OP_FLAG_RATIONALIZE_NORMALS) {
00435         bm_rationalize_normals(bm, 1);
00436     }
00437 #endif
00438 
00439     bm->opflag = 0;
00440 
00441     /* compute normals, clear temp flags and flush selections */
00442     BM_mesh_normals_update(bm, TRUE);
00443     BM_mesh_select_mode_flush(bm);
00444 }
00445 
00446 void BM_mesh_elem_index_ensure(BMesh *bm, const char hflag)
00447 {
00448     BMIter iter;
00449     BMElem *ele;
00450 
00451 #ifdef DEBUG
00452     BM_ELEM_INDEX_VALIDATE(bm, "Should Never Fail!", __func__);
00453 #endif
00454 
00455     if (hflag & BM_VERT) {
00456         if (bm->elem_index_dirty & BM_VERT) {
00457             int index = 0;
00458             BM_ITER_MESH (ele, &iter, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH) {
00459                 BM_elem_index_set(ele, index); /* set_ok */
00460                 index++;
00461             }
00462             bm->elem_index_dirty &= ~BM_VERT;
00463             BLI_assert(index == bm->totvert);
00464         }
00465         else {
00466             // printf("%s: skipping vert index calc!\n", __func__);
00467         }
00468     }
00469 
00470     if (hflag & BM_EDGE) {
00471         if (bm->elem_index_dirty & BM_EDGE) {
00472             int index = 0;
00473             BM_ITER_MESH (ele, &iter, bm, BM_EDGES_OF_MESH) {
00474                 BM_elem_index_set(ele, index); /* set_ok */
00475                 index++;
00476             }
00477             bm->elem_index_dirty &= ~BM_EDGE;
00478             BLI_assert(index == bm->totedge);
00479         }
00480         else {
00481             // printf("%s: skipping edge index calc!\n", __func__);
00482         }
00483     }
00484 
00485     if (hflag & BM_FACE) {
00486         if (bm->elem_index_dirty & BM_FACE) {
00487             int index = 0;
00488             BM_ITER_MESH (ele, &iter, bm, BM_FACES_OF_MESH) {
00489                 BM_elem_index_set(ele, index); /* set_ok */
00490                 index++;
00491             }
00492             bm->elem_index_dirty &= ~BM_FACE;
00493             BLI_assert(index == bm->totface);
00494         }
00495         else {
00496             // printf("%s: skipping face index calc!\n", __func__);
00497         }
00498     }
00499 }
00500 
00501 
00513 void BM_mesh_elem_index_validate(BMesh *bm, const char *location, const char *func,
00514                                  const char *msg_a, const char *msg_b)
00515 {
00516     const char iter_types[3] = {BM_VERTS_OF_MESH,
00517                                 BM_EDGES_OF_MESH,
00518                                 BM_FACES_OF_MESH};
00519 
00520     const char flag_types[3] = {BM_VERT, BM_EDGE, BM_FACE};
00521     const char *type_names[3] = {"vert", "edge", "face"};
00522 
00523     BMIter iter;
00524     BMElem *ele;
00525     int i;
00526     int is_any_error = 0;
00527 
00528     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
00529         const int is_dirty = (flag_types[i] & bm->elem_index_dirty);
00530         int index = 0;
00531         int is_error = FALSE;
00532         int err_val = 0;
00533         int err_idx = 0;
00534 
00535         BM_ITER_MESH (ele, &iter, bm, iter_types[i]) {
00536             if (!is_dirty) {
00537                 if (BM_elem_index_get(ele) != index) {
00538                     err_val = BM_elem_index_get(ele);
00539                     err_idx = index;
00540                     is_error = TRUE;
00541                 }
00542             }
00543 
00544             BM_elem_index_set(ele, index); /* set_ok */
00545             index++;
00546         }
00547 
00548         if ((is_error == TRUE) && (is_dirty == FALSE)) {
00549             is_any_error = TRUE;
00550             fprintf(stderr,
00551                     "Invalid Index: at %s, %s, %s[%d] invalid index %d, '%s', '%s'\n",
00552                     location, func, type_names[i], err_idx, err_val, msg_a, msg_b);
00553         }
00554         else if ((is_error == FALSE) && (is_dirty == TRUE)) {
00555 
00556 #if 0       /* mostly annoying */
00557 
00558             /* dirty may have been incorrectly set */
00559             fprintf(stderr,
00560                     "Invalid Dirty: at %s, %s (%s), dirty flag was set but all index values are correct, '%s', '%s'\n",
00561                     location, func, type_names[i], msg_a, msg_b);
00562 #endif
00563         }
00564     }
00565 
00566 #if 0 /* mostly annoying, even in debug mode */
00567 #ifdef DEBUG
00568     if (is_any_error == 0) {
00569         fprintf(stderr,
00570                 "Valid Index Success: at %s, %s, '%s', '%s'\n",
00571                 location, func, msg_a, msg_b);
00572     }
00573 #endif
00574 #endif
00575     (void) is_any_error; /* shut up the compiler */
00576 
00577 }
00578 
00582 int BM_mesh_elem_count(BMesh *bm, const char htype)
00583 {
00584     if (htype == BM_VERT) return bm->totvert;
00585     else if (htype == BM_EDGE) return bm->totedge;
00586     else if (htype == BM_FACE) return bm->totface;
00587 
00588     return 0;
00589 }
00590 
00603 void BM_mesh_remap(BMesh *bm, int *vert_idx, int *edge_idx, int *face_idx)
00604 {
00605     /* Mapping old to new pointers. */
00606     GHash *vptr_map = NULL, *eptr_map = NULL, *fptr_map = NULL;
00607     BMIter iter, iterl;
00608     BMVert *ve;
00609     BMEdge *ed;
00610     BMFace *fa;
00611     BMLoop *lo;
00612 
00613     if (!(vert_idx || edge_idx || face_idx))
00614         return;
00615 
00616     /* Remap vertices */
00617     if (vert_idx) {
00618         BMVert **verts_pool, *verts_copy, **vep;
00619         int i, totvert = bm->totvert;
00620         int *new_idx = NULL;
00621 
00622         /* Init the old-to-new vert pointers mapping */
00623         vptr_map = BLI_ghash_new(BLI_ghashutil_ptrhash, BLI_ghashutil_ptrcmp, "BM_mesh_remap vert pointers mapping");
00624 
00625         /* Make a copy of all vertices. */
00626         verts_pool = MEM_callocN(sizeof(BMVert *) * totvert, "BM_mesh_remap verts pool");
00627         BM_iter_as_array(bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH, NULL, (void **)verts_pool, totvert);
00628         verts_copy = MEM_mallocN(sizeof(BMVert) * totvert, "BM_mesh_remap verts copy");
00629         for (i = totvert, ve = verts_copy + totvert - 1, vep = verts_pool + totvert - 1; i--; ve--, vep--) {
00630             *ve = **vep;
00631 /*          printf("*vep: %p, verts_pool[%d]: %p\n", *vep, i, verts_pool[i]);*/
00632         }
00633 
00634         /* Copy back verts to their new place, and update old2new pointers mapping. */
00635         new_idx = vert_idx + totvert - 1;
00636         ve = verts_copy + totvert - 1;
00637         vep = verts_pool + totvert - 1; /* old, org pointer */
00638         for (i = totvert; i--; new_idx--, ve--, vep--) {
00639             BMVert *new_vep = verts_pool[*new_idx];
00640             *new_vep = *ve;
00641 /*          printf("mapping vert from %d to %d (%p/%p to %p)\n", i, *new_idx, *vep, verts_pool[i], new_vep);*/
00642             BLI_ghash_insert(vptr_map, (void *)*vep, (void *)new_vep);
00643         }
00644         bm->elem_index_dirty |= BM_VERT;
00645 
00646         MEM_freeN(verts_pool);
00647         MEM_freeN(verts_copy);
00648     }
00649 
00650     /* XXX Code not tested yet (though I don't why it would fail)! */
00651     if (edge_idx) {
00652         BMEdge **edges_pool, *edges_copy, **edp;
00653         int i, totedge = bm->totedge;
00654         int *new_idx = NULL;
00655 
00656         /* Init the old-to-new vert pointers mapping */
00657         eptr_map = BLI_ghash_new(BLI_ghashutil_ptrhash, BLI_ghashutil_ptrcmp, "BM_mesh_remap edge pointers mapping");
00658 
00659         /* Make a copy of all vertices. */
00660         edges_pool = MEM_callocN(sizeof(BMEdge *) * totedge, "BM_mesh_remap edges pool");
00661         BM_iter_as_array(bm, BM_EDGES_OF_MESH, NULL, (void **)edges_pool, totedge);
00662         edges_copy = MEM_mallocN(sizeof(BMEdge) * totedge, "BM_mesh_remap edges copy");
00663         for (i = totedge, ed = edges_copy + totedge - 1, edp = edges_pool + totedge - 1; i--; ed--, edp--) {
00664             *ed = **edp;
00665         }
00666 
00667         /* Copy back verts to their new place, and update old2new pointers mapping. */
00668         new_idx = edge_idx + totedge - 1;
00669         ed = edges_copy + totedge - 1;
00670         edp = edges_pool + totedge - 1; /* old, org pointer */
00671         for (i = totedge; i--; new_idx--, ed--, edp--) {
00672             BMEdge *new_edp = edges_pool[*new_idx];
00673             *new_edp = *ed;
00674             BLI_ghash_insert(eptr_map, (void *)*edp, (void *)new_edp);
00675         }
00676 
00677         bm->elem_index_dirty |= BM_EDGE;
00678 
00679         MEM_freeN(edges_pool);
00680         MEM_freeN(edges_copy);
00681     }
00682 
00683     /* XXX Code not tested yet (though I don't why it would fail)! */
00684     if (face_idx) {
00685         BMFace **faces_pool, *faces_copy, **fap;
00686         int i, totface = bm->totface;
00687         int *new_idx = NULL;
00688 
00689         /* Init the old-to-new vert pointers mapping */
00690         fptr_map = BLI_ghash_new(BLI_ghashutil_ptrhash, BLI_ghashutil_ptrcmp, "BM_mesh_remap face pointers mapping");
00691 
00692         /* Make a copy of all vertices. */
00693         faces_pool = MEM_callocN(sizeof(BMFace *) * totface, "BM_mesh_remap faces pool");
00694         BM_iter_as_array(bm, BM_FACES_OF_MESH, NULL, (void **)faces_pool, totface);
00695         faces_copy = MEM_mallocN(sizeof(BMFace) * totface, "BM_mesh_remap faces copy");
00696         for (i = totface, fa = faces_copy + totface - 1, fap = faces_pool + totface - 1; i--; fa--, fap--) {
00697             *fa = **fap;
00698         }
00699 
00700         /* Copy back verts to their new place, and update old2new pointers mapping. */
00701         new_idx = face_idx + totface - 1;
00702         fa = faces_copy + totface - 1;
00703         fap = faces_pool + totface - 1; /* old, org pointer */
00704         for (i = totface; i--; new_idx--, fa--, fap--) {
00705             BMFace *new_fap = faces_pool[*new_idx];
00706             *new_fap = *fa;
00707             BLI_ghash_insert(fptr_map, (void *)*fap, (void *)new_fap);
00708         }
00709 
00710         bm->elem_index_dirty |= BM_FACE;
00711 
00712         MEM_freeN(faces_pool);
00713         MEM_freeN(faces_copy);
00714     }
00715 
00716     /* And now, fix all vertices/edges/faces/loops pointers! */
00717     /* Verts' pointers, only edge pointers... */
00718     if (eptr_map) {
00719         BM_ITER_MESH (ve, &iter, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH) {
00720 /*          printf("Vert e: %p -> %p\n", ve->e, BLI_ghash_lookup(eptr_map, (const void*)ve->e));*/
00721             ve->e = BLI_ghash_lookup(eptr_map, (const void *)ve->e);
00722         }
00723     }
00724 
00725     /* Edges' pointers, only vert pointers (as we don't mess with loops!)... */
00726     if (vptr_map) {
00727         BM_ITER_MESH (ed, &iter, bm, BM_EDGES_OF_MESH) {
00728 /*          printf("Edge v1: %p -> %p\n", ed->v1, BLI_ghash_lookup(vptr_map, (const void*)ed->v1));*/
00729 /*          printf("Edge v2: %p -> %p\n", ed->v2, BLI_ghash_lookup(vptr_map, (const void*)ed->v2));*/
00730             ed->v1 = BLI_ghash_lookup(vptr_map, (const void *)ed->v1);
00731             ed->v2 = BLI_ghash_lookup(vptr_map, (const void *)ed->v2);
00732         }
00733     }
00734 
00735     /* Faces' pointers (loops, in fact), always needed... */
00736     BM_ITER_MESH (fa, &iter, bm, BM_FACES_OF_MESH) {
00737         BM_ITER_ELEM (lo, &iterl, fa, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE) {
00738             if (vptr_map) {
00739 /*              printf("Loop v: %p -> %p\n", lo->v, BLI_ghash_lookup(vptr_map, (const void*)lo->v));*/
00740                 lo->v = BLI_ghash_lookup(vptr_map, (const void *)lo->v);
00741             }
00742             if (eptr_map) {
00743 /*              printf("Loop e: %p -> %p\n", lo->e, BLI_ghash_lookup(eptr_map, (const void*)lo->e));*/
00744                 lo->e = BLI_ghash_lookup(eptr_map, (const void *)lo->e);
00745             }
00746             if (fptr_map) {
00747 /*              printf("Loop f: %p -> %p\n", lo->f, BLI_ghash_lookup(fptr_map, (const void*)lo->f));*/
00748                 lo->f = BLI_ghash_lookup(fptr_map, (const void *)lo->f);
00749             }
00750         }
00751     }
00752 
00753     if (vptr_map)
00754         BLI_ghash_free(vptr_map, NULL, NULL);
00755     if (eptr_map)
00756         BLI_ghash_free(eptr_map, NULL, NULL);
00757     if (fptr_map)
00758         BLI_ghash_free(fptr_map, NULL, NULL);
00759 }
00760 
00761 BMVert *BM_vert_at_index(BMesh *bm, const int index)
00762 {
00763     return BLI_mempool_findelem(bm->vpool, index);
00764 }
00765 
00766 BMEdge *BM_edge_at_index(BMesh *bm, const int index)
00767 {
00768     return BLI_mempool_findelem(bm->epool, index);
00769 }
00770 
00771 BMFace *BM_face_at_index(BMesh *bm, const int index)
00772 {
00773     return BLI_mempool_findelem(bm->fpool, index);
00774 }
